cont.entity_a: Installation software does most of the work.
cont.entity_b: Maintains a stable wireless connection. User-friendly setup features.

cont.entity_a: Signal quality is poor at distances significantly less than the advertised 300 feet.
cont.entity_b: Provides excellent signal strength and fast download/upload speeds.

cont.entity_a: Documentation is incomplete and only supports older Windows versions.
Firmware updates are necessary for optimal performance. Firmware upgrades are essential to fix connectivity issues.
The range is less than claimed.
cont.entity_b: The router is extremely stable with fantastic range.

cont.entity_a: Occasionally not useful for advanced issues.
cont.entity_b: Provides good support for resolving setup issues.

cont.entity_a: Has good connectivity within a limited range. Issues with maintaining DHCP connections, requiring frequent resets. Frequently needs rebooting to maintain connections.
cont.entity_b: No connection drops. Supports stronger WiFi encryption for secure connections.

cont.entity_a: The router is not suitable for Macintosh users due to lack of support.
cont.entity_b: Supports both Xbox Live and Nintendo Wi-Fi without additional setup. Xbox Live certified.
Fast and reliable with many advanced settings. Works well with various gaming consoles and PCs.

cont.entity_a: The router has good firewall protection.
cont.entity_b: Supports stronger WiFi encryption for secure connections.
Offers advanced features for prioritizing packet routing.
Has overheating issues when stacked under another device.
